title: Understanding Enthalpy Change
text: After a system undergoes a cycle and returns to its initial state, certain thermodynamic properties must remain unchanged. Consider the properties that are state functions.

title: What is a State Function?
text: In thermodynamics, a state function is a property whose value does not depend on the path taken to reach that specific value, but only on the current state of the system.

title: Enthalpy as a State Function
text: Enthalpy (H) is a state function. It depends only on the initial and final states of the system, not on how the change occurs.

title: Conclusion on Enthalpy Change
text: Since the system returned to its initial state, the change in any state function should be zero.

title: Final Answer
text: The change in enthalpy, ΔH, is $$0$$ because enthalpy is a state function, and the system returned to its initial state.
